result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:11 AM Defendant Wyatt W Smith in court.  Attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty in court for Wyatt W Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  Defense requests a jury trial.  All Motions in Limine, Witness lists, Proposed Jury Instructions and changes to the Substantive Jury Instructions are due 48  hours before the Final Pretrial.  Parties are to check for witness availability for this scheduled trial date and inform the Court of any problems.
Jury trial scheduled for March 7, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for February 24, 2023 at 09:45 am.
Final pre-trial on February 24, 2023 at 09:45 am.
Jury trial on March 7, 2023 at 08:30 am.

8:40 AM Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Wyatt W Smith in court.  Attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty in court for Wyatt W Smith. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  Deft. has tested negative this morning.  Defense asks for another status.  Defense is waiting for an ofer.
Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: DA Autho to Def re Electronic Evidence

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No violent contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family). It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.
NG plea entered.

9:39 AM Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Wyatt W Smith in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty in court for Wyatt W Smith. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over. 
State notes the information filed removes count 4, misd battery. 
Defense moves to address bond, requesting a lower bond of $2500 cash.
State is in agreement to modifying bond.
BTC: Court grants bond modification, bond to be set at $2500 cash
Status conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No violent contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family). It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

1:30 PM Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Wyatt W Smith appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Addison R Kuhn appeared by video for Wyatt W Smith. Court Reporter Mark Garvin.
